About Dexcom:
Founded in 1999, Dexcom, Inc. provides continuous glucose monitoring technology to help patients and their clinicians better manage diabetes. Since our inception, we have focused on better outcomes for patients, caregivers, and clinicians by delivering solutions for people with diabetes - while empowering our community to take control of diabetes.
Summary:
The Senior Manager Biostatistics Data Scientist sits at the intersection of new market commercial and clinical strategy. This role will significantly contribute to the New Markets organization and inform clinical and business strategy by developing a deep understanding of device performance and effectiveness.
About New Markets:
Recently formed, the New Markets organization is an expanding, fully-dedicated team focused on creating significant value by driving Dexcom’s world-class continuous glucose monitoring (CGM) technology into new applications, such as non-intensive type 2 diabetes, prediabetes, the hospital and managed care facilities, and pregnancy (including gestational diabetes). These important initiatives are entrepreneurial by nature, as they may require novel go-to-market strategies and new technologies. Each member of this team will play a critical role in helping the New Markets organization first explore then realize the significant potential that exists within these exciting new opportunities.
Functional Description:
Manages the design, development and programs methods, processes, and systems to consolidate and analyze unstructured, diverse “big data” sources to generate actionable insights and solutions for client services and product enhancement. May lead the product and service teams to identify questions and issues for data analysis and experiments. Develops and codes software programs, algorithms and automated processes to cleanse, integrate and evaluate large datasets from multiple disparate sources. Identifies meaningful insights from large data and metadata sources; interprets and communicates insights and findings from analysis and experiments to product, service, and business managers.
Essential Duties & Responsibilities:
As a dedicated member of the New Markets organization, the Sr Manager Biostatistics Data Scientist will:
Work closely with the New Markets team to translate clinical and commercial questions into a structured analysis plan, formulate and test hypotheses using quantitative analysis (descriptive, statistical), visualizations and algorithms (machine learning), and provide meaningful insights and strategic recommendations to R&D for product development and commercialization.
Will use techniques from machine learning and statistical analysis on data (e.g.: continuous glucose data, Payor Claims, Hospital EHR data) to build knowledge of device accuracy and optimal utilization, patient behavior and care utilization.
Provide subject matter expertise to clinical study designs, statistical analysis and data outputs for clinical trials. Lead study statistical design, sample size calculations, development of statistical analysis plans, data review, and query management.
Optimize clinical systems and processes as they relate to clinical statistics including review of CRF and data base structures, senior review of database locks and validation of statistical analyses macro/programs.
Develop and execute statistical analysis plans in collaboration with CRO statisticians based on input from cross-functional study team and participate with Operations in the selection and management of statistics and data management suppliers (CROs) to include leading project timelines.
Collaborate with Regulatory Affairs, Clinical Affairs Biostatisticians and other data scientists to interact and communicate with FDA regarding regulatory submissions.
Conduct statistical analyses and discussions for abstracts and manuscripts including drafting analyses, findings and reports.
Required Qualifications:
A proven passion for generating insights from data, with a strong familiarity with the higher-level trends in data growth, open-source platforms, and public data sets.
Strong knowledge of biostatistical methods generally and data modeling.
Experience with open-source statistical languages and packages such as R and Python packages.
Experience working with relational databases and query languages (e.g. SQL, MapReduce, PIG, and Hive)
Working knowledge with open source cloud tools for big data analysis (e.g. Hortonworks Data Platform, Hive, Spark, Jupyter Notebook and Jupyter Lab).
Familiarity with visualization software and techniques such as Tableau, and business intelligence (BI) software
A team player, capable of conducting independent research, who is excited by and motivated by hard technical challenges
Excellent written and verbal communications skills, with a proven ability to translate complex methodologies and analytical results to publications and to higher-level business insights and takeaways
Previous leadership experience
Preferred Qualifications:
PhD is preferred. At least 8 years of experience (or combination of education and experience) in statistical analysis in clinical environments and biomedical industry; Education/experience in Bioinformatics is highly valued
Minimum of Master's degree (or equivalent) in Biostatistics, Bioinformatics or related field is required
A working knowledge of SAS and strong statistical analysis skills are required. Knowledge in R, Python, or any other computer language skill is highly valued. Must be able to work with minimal oversight and work as a member of a project team.
Experience with the Google Cloud Platform for data analysis including Big Query, Data Flow, Data Proc, ML Engine, Datalab, Tensorflow.
Experience working with Deep Learning, regression, classification, structured and unstructured learning and tailoring those methods and algorithms to solve business problems.
Experience and Education Requirements:
Typically requires a Bachelor’s degree with 13+ years of industry experience. 5-8 years of previous people management experience.
Travel Required:
Up to 25%

Passionate to eat better, Infarm was founded in Berlin in 2013 by Osnat Michaeli and the brothers Erez and Guy Galonska. With the aim to share the goodness of own-grown produce with everyone, they developed a smart modular farming system, that allows distribution of farms throughout the urban environment, growing fresh produce in any available space and fulfilling any market demand.

Today, with cutting edge R&D, patented technologies, and a leading multi-disciplinary team, Infarm is growing a global farming network helping cities become self-sufficient in their food production while significantly improving the safety, quality, and environmental footprint of our food.

Be part of the Infarm (r)evolution and help people to take back ownership of their food.

Who you are

At Infarm we grow a smart worldwide Infarm network that brings farming to the people. As the Data Scientist, you contribute to that mission by searching for patterns in financial data that can provide solutions to business problems or create new business opportunities. In this role, you will communicate clearly and effectively with both clients and multi-disciplinary teams and use advanced mathematical and computer science skills to analyze vast pools of data.

You appreciate diversity. You love to be challenged. You are passionate.

Work with stakeholders throughout the organization to identify opportunities for leveraging company, customer, and market data to drive business solutions
Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques, and business strategies
Analyze customer store data to evaluate key KPIs, understand trends, risks and opportunities; Propose solutions for identified risks/opportunities
Assist the management team with the development of expansion strategies including product offerings and regional market analysis
Gather and analyze market research data for various growth initiatives
Assist teams in analyzing data for efficiency/cost saving projects
Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques
Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets
Use predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, ad targeting, and other business outcomes
Develop company A/B testing framework and test model quality
Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes
Develop processes and tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy
Requirements
3+ years of experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models along with a Bachelor's degree (B. A. / B. S.) from four-year college or university in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or another quantitative field
Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SLQ, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets preferred
Strong MS Excel skills (data analysis, modeling, and functions) with SQL querying experience preferred
Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, regression, simulations, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, decision trees, statistical tests, and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications
Strong problem-solving skills with an emphasis on product development

What we offer
The opportunity to join Infarm as we expand across the globe and help change the future of farming
The ability to drive impact and be a true partner to the business, working closely with top-level managers
A friendly work environment with a diverse group of motivated, talented, and visionary colleagues

We believe an unprecedented crisis requires an unprecedented response. However, most governments lack the resources to procure the necessary software and services or hire their own data teams. In order to restore global health and prosperity, our Governments, agencies and NGOs around the world need our help.

Who We Are
Xaqt creates products that transform how organizations and governments use their data. We believe that with data and the right technology, people and institutions can solve hard problems and change the world for the better.
Xaqt is one of the hottest tech companies in Smart Cities and Contact Center AI. Our mission is to deploy the best products we can build against the hardest problems we can find, wherever we are needed most. Xaqt's powerful, connected intelligence platform has served as the foundation for transformative solutions in an incredibly diverse set of problem spaces.

Operation Onward
Xaqt is assembling a team of the brightest minds and talent in the world to defeat COVID-19 permanently and create a resilient data infrastructure for governments and global citizens well into the future. Beyond responding to the immediate crisis at hand, we also have a rare opportunity to rethink the cities we call home with data driven analysis at the core.
Operation Onward will provide Cities, Governments and NGOS with pro bono services and technology (ie, hosted data and analytics infrastructure) to address their most pressing needs. Onward volunteers will use open source technologies such as Apache Superset, Presto, Python, etc. to build data analysis, dashboards and portals to create a better understanding of the current situation and predicted outcomes. These could range from quantifying the economic impact of the virus on local communities to predicting healthcare utilization or even building privacy first contact tracing models.

What you will do
These will be far-reaching roles that will have dramatic impact across all aspects of our COVID-19 response. Some team members will be responsible for architecting and assembling a world class, open source, data platform and architecture that will be fully managed by the Onward team or ready to be deployed into a City's existing cloud environment.
For Data Scientists, you will either be pared directly with a City or NGO to solve for their most pressing data related questions, such as determining when its safe to reopen local businesses and schools; or you may work on predictive models that apply at macro level, such as forecasting potential hotspots based on national and global mobility patterns. We expect these will be 2 week to 2 month long engagements, depending on your availability and our government partner needs.

You will work closely with governments to understand their goals through effective communication, abstract requirements gathering, and collaborative road-mapping.

Our team is highly collaborative and has a lean mentality to quickly build, measure, and learn.You will analyze requirements, provide product solutions & recommendations, and translate decisions into an impactful product that serves our organizations and their end users.
About the positions
We are looking for skilled Data Architects, Engineers, Scientists, Analysts and BI developers who will help us analyze large amounts of raw information to find patterns and use them to answer the most pressing COVID-19 related questions. You will build data products to extract valuable insights, analyze trends and help our partners make better decisions.
We expect you to be highly analytical with a knack for analysis, math and statistics, and a passion for machine-learning and research. Critical thinking and problem-solving skills are also required.
Note, as the economy recovers and opportunities arise for paid engagements, many of these positions may convert into full-time employment for the right team members.
General Responsibilities are:
Perform preprocessing of structured and unstructured data
Research and detect valuable data sources and automate collection processes
Review large amounts of information to discover trends and patterns
Create predictive models and machine-learning algorithms
Modify and combine different models
Organize and present information using data visualization techniques
Develop and suggest solutions and strategies to government challenges
Work together with engineering and product development teams
Lead the research, ideation, and creation of the data products roadmaps for world's first open source urban intelligence platform
Requirements are:
We understand our volunteers are in varying stages of searching for full time work, and we will be flexible in accommodating your situation. We're looking for the following basic requirements.
Ability to commit to critical projects, either part-time or full-time
Experience in data mining, machine-learning and operations research
Good experience using business intelligence tools (such as Superset) and data frameworks (such as Presto)
Good knowledge of SQL and Python
Strong communication and presentation skills
Good problem-solving abilities
Apache Superset, Amundsen, Airflow, Cadence (Uber), Presto, Spark, Kafka, Apache Pinot, Druid a huge plus.
